page.title: 16ASTON-J-M SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The{sewage works}in the South of the region covers about 5 acres and processes the raw untreated sewage from Crewe. It runs on a{sludge {digestion system}. Sewage is sent by gravity feed through under- and over- ground pipes and after being broken down into sludge by aerobic bacteria it is sent into large sealed tanks called digesters.Here it is heated and further broken down releasing{Methane gas, which is used for heating the digesters.{Waste water}is sent into the River Weaver and the{processed {sludge}is then dehydrated and pressed. This harmless waste product can then be used as fertiliser or spread on the land. The works is continually monitored and maintained by a small team of workers, including a chemist and a mechanic.
